description: very tiny round image with figure at left with large halo; radiating circle with text in circle around image
provenance: John E. Andrus III (Wayzata, Minn.); Julie Andrus (Minneapolis, Minn.)
signed: below image in the plate (?): John Taylor Arms 1936
text: Many artists have made miniature prints, but this one pushes the envelope. On a surface about the size of a high school class ring, John Taylor Arms depicts the Nativity, with Mary adoring the baby Jesus, who lies in the manger. The Latin inscription may be translated as “Glory to God in the highest, and peace on earth to men of good will." According to the biblical account of Luke, this was the message of the angels to the shepherds.
title: Nativity
